I recently found the Computer Vision League Osaka (CVL-Osaka) alliance gathering CV reseachers around Osaka. Until March 2020, I was an assistant professor at the Department of Intelligent Media (Yagi Lab.). I received my Ph.D. (Doctor of Engineering) in March 2014 from Nara Institute of Science and Technology (NAIST), Japan, under the supervision of Professor Naokazu Yokoya in Vision and Media Computing Lab.	After receiving my Ph.D., I visited the REVES group at INRIA Sophia-Antipolis, France and worked with Dr. George Drettakis, Dr. Adrien Bousseau, and Dr. Kenneth Vanhoey in collaboration with Professor Alyosha Efros (UC Berkeley).
